Functions
Reset
void Reset()

Clears the Lua stack.

RegisterFunc
void RegisterFunc(
const char *funcname,
lua_CFunction func
)

Registers a global function to use from Lua.

Parameters
funcname
const char*

The name that will be used to call the function in Lua

func
lua_CFunction

The C function to register

RegisterLib
void RegisterLib(
const char *libname,
const luaL_Reg lib[],
int nlib
)

Registers a library/module to use from Lua.

Parameters
libname
const char*

The name that will be used to reference the library/module in Lua

lib
const luaL_Reg[]

An array of C functions to register

nlib
int

The number of C functions to register (arrays don't store their size)

ExecFile
bool ExecFile(
const char *filename,
std::string &error
)

Reads and executes a Lua file.

Parameters
filename
const char*

The name of the file

error
std::string&

Any error message is stored in this parameter

Returns

If an error occurred return false, otherwise true

ExecFunc
bool ExecFunc(
const char *filename,
const char *funcname,
const std::vector<LuaParam> &params,
std::vector<LuaParam> &retValues,
std::string &error
)

Loads a Lua chunk (file) and executes a function from it.

Parameters
filename
const char*

The name of the file

funcname
const char*

The name of the function

params
const std::vector<LuaParam>&

A list of the parameters for the function

retVals

The return values of the function call are put into this list

error
std::string&

Any error message is stored in this parameter

Returns

If an error occurred return false, otherwise true

RegisterClass
template<typename T> void RegisterClass()

Registers a class to Lua.

Template type:

T

The class to register

PushObject
template<typename T> void PushObject(
T *obj,
const std::string &name,
bool gc = false
)

Push a new class instance to the global namespace in Lua.

Parameters
obj
T*

A pointer to the object to push

name
const std::string&

The name with which Lua can access the object

gc
bool

Whether the object should be deleted when Lua does garbage collection (default: false)

Template type:

T

The class to register

Example
Foo foo;
LuaManager::PushObject(&foo, "foo1");
LuaManager::PushObject(new Foo, "foo2", true);
